document_data.name: Zombie Lord
document_data.mainbody: '''Zombie lords''' were [[undead]] creatures that resembled regular [[zombie]]s with greater intelligence and powers. They were a rare occurrence, usually created from a living [[humanoid]] via a ''[[raise dead]]'' gone wrong.
document_data.Description: Most zombie lords retained the features they had in life but appeared deathly grey, with their flesh decaying. They reeked of rot and corruption, attracting carrion feeders and insects.
document_data.Abilities:
These undead creatures could establish a  ''[[telepathy|telepathic]]'' connection to other undead creatures, freely communicating with them. 

Zombie lords could animate a dead body once a day, creating a subservient zombie. The same ability could be used on living creatures weaker than the zombie lord.

Zombie lords were affected by ''[[turn undead]]'' similarly to [[vampires]].

Zombie lords had immunity to certain spells and abilities. They could not be affected by ''[[sleep]]'', ''[[charm]]'', ''[[hold undead]]'', [[death magic]], [[disease]]s, life and ability drain, paralysis, and [[poison]]. Some individual zombie lords had the innate ability to cast ''[[spell mantle]]'' and ''[[stoneskin]]'' spells. They were susceptible to being damaged by ''[[holy water]]'' and ''[[holy symbol]]s''.
document_data.Behavior: Even though they were intelligent, as much as any average humanoid, zombie lords' minds were razor-focused on death, killing, and growing their zombie hordes.
document_data.Combat: In battle, zombie lords primarily used their brutal strength. The lords usually retained weapon skills and abilities they had in life. The main danger, however, was the putrid stench that surrounded these creatures. Any living creature within {{SI|10'|'"|long=yes}} from a zombie lord was affected by the poisonous odor with various effects on their wellbeing. These effects could result in weakness, constitution drain, a ''[[contagion]]'' spell-like effect, catching a [[disease]], nausea, and vomiting for 1â€“4 minutes. Some very unlucky living beings could die instantly under the effects of the poisonous stench and immediately become zombies under the lord's control.
document_data.Society: Zombie lords were intelligent and could speak all the languages they knew when they were living beings.
document_data.History:
During the [[Weeping War]], the surviving defenders of the [[Dwarven Dungeons]] opened the ''Nightmare [[Gate]]'' to the [[Negative Energy plane]] in a desperate attempt to fend off the [[Army of Darkness]]. The gate was never sealed as the city of [[Myth Drannor]] fell to the invaders. The ''gate'' remained open until [[1369 DR]], flooding the ruins with undead creatures, many of which were zombie lords.

''Circa'' [[1372 DR]], multiple zombie lords were spotted in death-filled areas, graveyards, and ancient tombs of the [[Sword Coast North]], such as in [[Neverwinter]]
